Description: Year for which to retrieve cost assumptions of ``resources/costs.csv``.
Version of ``technology-data`` repository to use. If this string is of the form <user>/<repo>/<version> then costs are instead retrieved from ``github.com/<user>/<repo>`` at the <version> tag.
Social discount rate to compare costs in different investment periods. 0.02 corresponds to a social discount rate of 2%.
Default values if not specified for a technology in ``resources/costs.csv``.
Path to the custom costs file. None if it should not be used. Default ``data/custom_costs.csv`` contains minor adjustments for stabilising the optimisation results.

Values: Keys should be in the 'parameter' column of ``resources/costs.csv``. Values are dictionaries with keys from the  'technology' column of ``resources/costs.csv`` and float values.
Description: For the given parameters and technologies, assumptions about their parameter are overwritten the corresponding value of the technology.

Values: Keys should be in the 'technology' column of ``resources/costs.csv``. Values can be any float.
Description: For the given technologies, assumptions about their capital investment costs are set to the corresponding value. Optional; overwrites cost assumptions from ``resources/costs.csv``.

Values: Keys should be in the 'technology' column of ``resources/costs.csv``. Values can be any float.
Description: For the given technologies, assumptions about their marginal operating costs are set to the corresponding value. Optional; overwrites cost assumptions from ``resources/costs.csv``.
Specify exogenous prices for emission types listed in ``network.carriers`` to marginal costs.

Add cost for a carbon-dioxide price configured in ``costs: emission_prices: co2`` to ``marginal_cost`` of generators. Config setting can also be enabled with the keyword ``Ep`` in the ``{opts}`` wildcard.

Values: float or dictionary with planning horizons as keys.
Description: Exogenous price of carbon-dioxide. In electricity-only runs it is added to the marginal costs of fossil-fuelled generators according to their carbon intensity, while for sector networks it applies to emissions ending up in CO2 atmosphere.
Add monthly cost for a carbon-dioxide price based on historical values built by the rule ``build_monthly_prices``
